intro: Lissocarpa stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited lissocarpa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of central and eastern Europe, including parts of Poland, Ukraine, and Russia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of many members of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
